message.content:
We start by extracting the following key figures from each statement:

1. Cash Flow Statement:
 • Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –224133.22  
 • Purchase of Fixed Assets = 106218.20  
  → Free Cash Flow (FCF) = Operating CF – Capital Expenditures  
   = –224133.22 – 106218.20  
   = –330351.42

2. Balance Sheet:
 • Total Assets (beginning) = 13000000.00  
 • Total Assets (ending) = 15023526.85  
  → Average Total Assets = (13000000.00 + 15023526.85) / 2  
   = 28023526.85 / 2  
   = 14011763.43  
 • Total Owner’s Equity (beginning) = 13000000.00  
 • Total Owner’s Equity (ending) = 14193771.08  
  → Average Owner’s Equity = (13000000.00 + 14193771.08) / 2  
   = 27193771.08 / 2  
   = 13596885.54

3. Income Statement:
 • Net Profit = 1193771.08  
 • Total Revenue = 5695115.02  
 • Gross Profit = 2610115.02

Now, we compute the ratios:

A. Return on Assets (ROA)  
 ROA = Net Profit / Average Total Assets  
  = 1193771.08 / 14011763.43  
  ≈ 0.0852 → 8.52%

B. Return on Equity (ROE)  
 ROE = Net Profit / Average Owner’s Equity  
  = 1193771.08 / 13596885.54  
  ≈ 0.0878 → 8.78%

C. Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio  
 = Operating Cash Flow / Net Profit  
  = (–224133.22) / 1193771.08  
  ≈ –0.1877 → –0.19

D. Net Profit Margin  
 = Net Profit / Total Revenue  
  = 1193771.08 / 5695115.02  
  ≈ 0.2095 → 20.95%

E. Gross Profit Margin  
 = Gross Profit / Total Revenue  
  = 2610115.02 / 5695115.02  
  ≈ 0.4585 → 45.85%

Thus, the final answer in the requested json format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Free Cash Flow (FCF)": "-330351.42",
    "Return on Assets (ROA)": "8.52%",
    "Return on Equity (ROE)": "8.78%",
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "-0.19",
    "Net Profit Margin": "20.95%",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "45.85%"
  }
}
